visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly sales performance trends using synthetic data with seasonal variation and year-end surge patterns
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series with 12 monthly observations of synthetic sales data. Temporal variables use ordinal month categories with ratio-scale monetary values. Synthetic data (μ=166.9K, σ=57.2K) demonstrates 15% YTD growth with Q4 holiday surge (+19% Nov-Dec) and summer seasonality. The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio per Tufte by eliminating gridlines while maintaining Cairo's proportional ink principle through area-under-curve encoding. The red annotation label employs pre-attentive color coding (ΔE > 20 from background) for quick visual定位 of deselected points. Interactive elements follow Nielsen's usability heuristics with immediate feedback on point selection states.
